H0.text: Embryos are used to classify invertebrates (and higher animals) into one of two groups based on how they develop.

H1.text: Chromosomes are the basis for placing invertebrates (and higher animals) into one of two groups based on how they develop.

H2.text: Hormones are what invertebrates (and higher animals) can be placed in one of two groups based on how they develop.

H3.text: Cells are what invertebrates (and higher animals) develop as when they are placed in one of two groups based on how they develop.

A4.text: Protostome and deuterostome embryos differ in several other ways.
